captions.text:
♪ singin' in the rain,
just singin' in the rain ♪

♪ and singin',
just singin' in the rain ♪

This is dora bailey
talking to you

From the chinese theater
in hollywood.

Every star
in hollywood's heaven is here

To make monumental pictures'
premiere of <i>the royal rascal</i>

The arrival of lina lamont
and don lockwood.

comments.text:
Why are the captions screwed up? Also, does anybody know why RF, Don, and 
Cosmo pulled on the ropes backstage to open the curtain? Did they do it by 
accident or on purpose? If they DID do it on purpose, why? Why did they do 
it? Did they do it to expose and maybe embarrass Lima? I always wondered 
about that.﻿
comments.author: Gamefan113

comments.text: they Did it to expose her
comments.author: Jimmy Stewart

comments.text:
+Catomix I thought that Lina could sue RF if they had written or said 
anything about her that she doesn't like, so they pulled on the ropes 
because technically, they hadn't said anything about her.
comments.author: Nicole Telford

comments.text:
Lina had been threatening to sue RF because she didn't want anyone to know 
about Kathy, and under her contract, I think she had enough legal rights to 
get away with that lawsuit. So at the last minute here, the guys improvise 
a way for the public to find out about Kathy and get some revenge on Lina 
at the same time. I assume that they expected Lina to be so scandalized 
that she wouldn't have the nerve to sue, or that even if she did sue, the 
cost would be worth getting Kathy the exposure she deserved for her own 
career.
comments.author: Catomix

comments.text:
Jean Hagen provided her own SPEAKING voice for that dub / dub silent movie 
scene. However for that scene Jean's singing was dubbed by Betty Noyes, who 
also dubbed Debbie for some songs
comments.author: rogerwoof

comments.text:
"Debbie performed her own vocals for the more upbeat numbers in SINGIN' IN 
THE RAIN, including "All I Do Is Dream of You," "Good Mornin'" and "Singin' 
in the Rain in A-Flat." However, her singing voice was dubbed (by vocalist 
Betty Noyes) for three of the film's ballads, including "Would You?", the 
"Would You?" reprise with Kelly, and the final "You Are My Lucky Star" duet 
with Kelly."
comments.author: rogerwoof

comments.text:
NO no Betty Noyes sung "Would You?" and "You are My Lucky Star". It's 
documented in the BFI Film Classics book on Singin' In the Rain by Peter 
Wollen! when Kathy is supposedly dubbing Lina's voice in the live 
performance of "Singing in the Rain" at the end of the film, Jean Hagen is 
actually dubbing Reynolds' singing voice. At least look at the wikipedia.
comments.author: Mandakhnar

comments.text:
It is not! lol it is Betty Noyes...look up the movie creds! It was said on 
a biography on TCM as well... but in this video it is Debbie Reynolds 
singing... in "Would You" Kathy is dubbed by Betty Noyes...
comments.author: maurepasgirl

comments.text: jean hegan sang only this song which is seen as dubbed by kathy
comments.author: Mandakhnar

comments.text: actually jean hegan is singing
comments.author: Mandakhnar

comments.text: I can't find that song anywhere on Youtube! D:
comments.author: Amelia-Marie Altstadt

comments.text:
I have read her biography and seen the movie credits..and it was in Betty 
Noyes whom Debbie Reynolds was lip-syncing to for "Would You"....They did a 
biography on TCM by Robert Osbourne talking about it...seeing as Betty 
Noyes also sang "You are my Lucky Star" and the voices sound exactly the 
same in that and "Would You"...
comments.author: maurepasgirl

comments.text:
Jean Hagen dubbing Debbie Reynold's singing voice isn't a rumour. It is 
documented in the BFI Film Classics book on Singin' In the Rain by Peter 
Wollen (p.56) -- and Wollen quotes Debbie Reynolds in the process of 
discussing this. And it was only "Would you". The remaining songs were 
dubbed by Betty Noyes. This is documented in another authoritative place, 
but I'll have to look for that as it isn't as immediately to hand as the 
BFI book was.
comments.author: Susan Z. Swan

comments.text:
There is a rumor that Hagen spoke and sang with her real voice in the 
scenes where Lina is supposedly being dubbed by Kathy. This is only partly 
true. Hagen did "dub" her own speaking voice in those scenes, but she did 
not do her own singing. The singing done on "Would You?" was done neither 
by Hagen nor Reynolds but by Betty Noyes, who also dubs Reynolds in the 
finale, a duet of "You Are My Lucky Star" with Gene Kelly..Betty Noyes sang 
"Would You"..Jean Hagen did not sing any of the songs..
comments.author: maurepasgirl

comments.text:
Actually it is both. Betty Noyes does in some of the songs, but in Would 
You, it is actually Jean Hagen.
comments.author: Susan Z. Swan

comments.text:
Haha once again Debbie Reynolds also sang "Lucky Star"...the only song in 
this movie that she did not sing for herself was "Would You" which was sung 
by Betty Noyes... The credits are shown at the end of the movie and for a 
better view of them look at the site IMDB... You can tell the difference 
between the voices as Debbie Reynolds has a voice similar to her speaking 
voice..lol i love this movie so you can say i've done my research... :)
comments.author: maurepasgirl

"Lucky Star" in the movie but not "Singin In The Rain".
